Details: Fourth-grade reading scores declined 3 points nationally from 2024 to 2028 assessment cycle
Community college enrollment increased 8% in Fall 2027 - first significant increase since 2019
Achievement gap in mathematics between high and low-income students widened to 35 points on NAEP scale
Rural high school graduation rates improved 4 percentage points over 5-year period reaching 89%
15 states reporting critical teacher shortages in STEM and special education exceeding 20% vacancy rates
English learner student population increased 12% nationally over past 3 years - highest growth in Southeast
Six-year graduation rate for Pell Grant recipients reached 58% - 5 point improvement from 2020
42 states now administering all state assessments via computer-based platforms - up from 28 in 2023
Chronic absenteeism rates remain 30% above pre-pandemic levels affecting 16 million students nationally
State education spending per pupil increased 4.2% in FY2027 adjusting for inflation
12 additional states announced universal pre-K initiatives for FY2029 implementation
First-generation college student enrollment at 4-year institutions increased 7% from 2025 to 2027
